author: Jason Mulek
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2017
review_content: I have tried all kinds of filters.  These are not the best filters you can buy - but I will tell you for the money - they work great.  I have a friend in the industry that told me to stop buying the crazy expensive filters - and just buy cheaper filters and replace them more often.So after using these for 3 months - I have found them to perform as good as the comparable brand that I can buy at the big box store.  And I really like that I found ones online that I like, so I can just order them from Amazon.I think these are a great value - they compare to ones that cost a bit more -and do a great job.I also run my fan in the house all the time.  24/7.  I do this because it keeps the house balanced better.  Winter and Summer.  Now there is a great debate about leaving your fan on AUTO or ON.  You can read that debate and decide for yourself it its worth it.  But just know, I run mine 24/7 and use these filters.  And I think they are just great.
title: Great for running your fan 24/7

author: eejtalk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2018
review_content: I bought this based on a good price and ad I heard on talk radio. I saw a review saying they weren’t the right size, but ignored them as I was in a hurry and figured they messed up ordering the wrong product. Clearly, they were correct. I can’t believe they sell these as one size and then list a smaller “actual size”. Um, I’m sorry, this isn’t a product that needs a lot of tolerance. It should be the correct size or very slightly smaller. There is so much room that the filter won't do anything as the air will just go around this. I managed to wedge it in the side, but am throwing the other 3 away. I wish I had just returned them.Let’s be honest, these filters sole purpose is to protect your furnace, not to be a whole home air filter. If you’re using it for that, you’re doing it wrong. Anyway, it doesn’t have to sealed and super tight, but being almost an inch smaller will affect the life of the fan and heating element. It just seems dishonest. I’m disappointed in this “made in USA” product.
title: Ridiculously Small. Trash.

author: De
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2018
review_content: The filter I ordered was supposed to be 1x20x24. The actual size is 3/4x19.5x23.5 which is too small for my unit's filter opening. It lets air in around it and flops back and forth every time the fan goes on. I did not retain the original packing so there's no way I can return this without buying a new shipping box. That's my mistake and a $30 lesson learned. I'm  now using masking tape to hold the filter in place and to stop the air bypassing the filter. Buy at your own risk but I will not buy these again or recommend these to anyone.
title: Wrong Size Labeled and Described.

author: Amber Renae
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2015
review_content: I have bought numerous different air filters for my house without ever really doing my research on what I am actually buying. I have spent upwards of $25 per filter in various stores. After doing my research I found that I could order these filters that don't have that "brand name" save money and also protect the air in my house as well as the furnace. Here is what MERV 8 is designed for:MERV 5 – 8Most commercial applications and better residential buildings75%-85% of all particles in your air would be trapped in the filter. You can also going higher MERV ratings which will increase particle collection. The MERV rating goes up to MERV16 which traps 95% of airborne particles.These filters are perfect for residential use. Hope this helps a little bit to better understand these acronyms and what filter is best because I had no clue until doing a little research. Also the filters edge is easy to bend, thus I warn to be very gently when installing. I would start with one sides edges first. Get them in place tightly against the vent frame then fit the other side in. If the correct dimensions were ordered the fit should be easy, fast, and without any damage to the filter itself.
title: Great product that preforms to store brands that cost so much more!

author: Mark Harris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2017
review_content: I am immensely satisfied with these filters. This size is very hard to find and was not available at Loews or Home Depot stores. I did my research on MERV ratings and the prices on the 4-pack were great. Easily fit into the air filter slot (be sure to know the direction of air flow...insert with arrow aligned to air flow direction). When combined with my new air purifier that cleaned the incoming return air, I was sleeping soundly and awakening clear headed in no time. The MERV 8 filter is perfect and doesn't overwork the a/c unit. Highly recommended for purchase.
title: Immensely satisfied

author: Hamish
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2018
review_content: You have probably seen this in other reviews, but the actual size you get is slightly smaller than what you buy. For example, I bought a pack of 14x14 and 18x18, and the sizes I got were 13.5x13.5 and 17.25x17.25. I wish they were more upfront about that.That being said, these are PERFECT for my HVAC system. I don’t know how other houses are set up, but our returns in our house (the area you put these filters) have bolts and screws on the inside, so I used to have to really wedge in filters that were the “true” size. It always took 5 minutes or so of force before with older, bigger filters to force them in, but these just pop in.The actual quality itself is great. It’s a MERV rating of 8 (more than enough for most residential households) and quality wise it’s better than comparable priced filters you’ll find at other department stores. We actually got a new HVAC system installed and I asked the technicians about these and they said they were great and not to overpay for other brands (unless you REALLY need a higher allergy rating or other specialized filter for pets).Overall - highly recommended. Will definitely be buying this brand from now on.
title: Perfect filters

author: Busybuildr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2017
review_content: The filters seem well made with metal reinforcement on the downwind side and cardboard grate on both sides.  They are, however, smaller than advertised.The actual size is 15-3/8" x 23-3/8" x 3/4", and this information is clearly printed on the product. This undersized thickness leaves a large gap between the filter and the opening on my furnace.  I was hoping for a full sized thickness to better fill the opening on my furnace.
title: "16 x 24 x 1" MERV 8 filter

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2017
review_content: I immediately replaced my filter which I got from Home Depot which this. It's slightly smaller than 20x25x1, but it shouldn't be a problem for my AC return.I can only imagine this would save a lot of trouble for others buyers if it is printed clearly next to the size advertised on amazon.Although on the filter itself the actual size as well as the advertised are both printed.Overall I would say this seems like a great buy for the money. They come in 4.
title: Overall I would say this seems like a great buy for the money

author: L. Dubb
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2018
review_content: Having been in the same house, and buying the same size filters for 24 years, these are the most undersized filters that I have ever seen.  I have had Honeywell, 3M Filtrete, and Perfect Pleat filters in the past, and all of them have fit nice and snug in the standard return air grille filter compartment.After installing one of these filters, there was at least an 1/8" - 1/4" gap on three sides that would allow unfiltered air to pass by the filter.It's too bad because they're actually well built for the money, however with them being this undersized and allowing unfiltered air and dirt to reach my indoor coil...  these filters are worth nothing.
title: Very Undersized

author: RickLS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2018
review_content: 99 out of 100  Amazon stuff is Absolutely fine. - "This is the ONE"  .. I read some reviews about these items received mess up / not  exact size etc. and figured it was the just "luck of the draw" so I went for it. title: 99 out of 100 Amazon stuff is Absolutely fine. - "This is the ONE"

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2019
review_content: I read so many reviews and compared Merv numbers I thought I had made a good decision.  However, it is too dense and does not let the air filter through.  Consequently, the air coming of of the registers is almost non-existent.  I was arranging to have the ducts cleaned since I thought this was the problem.  Then I called the furnace guy  to get an estimate as to what it would cost to  remove the air conditioner coil etc. so the duct cleaner could get to the source to clean the ducts.  He checked out my furnace, took out the filter to see what would happen and there was much more air.  So, he bought a new filter for me that will filter the air but still let air pass through.  This saved me over $1000.00 between what his fee would have been and the duct cleaning fee.  The filters that I bought from Amazon were well made - no problem there.  They just would not be feasible for my situation.
title: Did not work for me

author: S. Torres
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2018
review_content: Arrived in poor shape. Each filter damaged. (The shipment box was in perfect shape, so clearly not a shipping issue!). Poorly made. Each filter has crushed or torn pleats. The cardboard is inferior and is also ripped, misaligned or not even glued in areas! For the amount of money it cost, expected much better. Have ordered before, that pack was decent. Very disappointed!

author: MSCC

review_content: I am pleased with the price and the overall use of this product. I changed the filter for this one and with the first restart of the furnace the dust was no longer setting on my furniture. I will never buy another filter (wont name brand) just because the cost was low!
title: GREAT FILTER

author: Krista and Aaron
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2018
review_content: Absolutely awful. If you have allergies of any sort, DO NOT BUY THESE FILTERS. They barely last a month and they have done a terrible job.I would not recommend these AT ALL.
title: NEVER AGAIN!

author: Jason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2018
review_content: Ok. I bought 10x10x1 filters... I specifically checked the actual size, 9.5x9.5x3/4. This fits perfectly.But then the box arrives. I tried fitting the filter and it didn't fit into the housing. Ok so I look at it... It says 9 3/4 x 9 3/4 x 3/4. THATS NOT THE SAME THING.Look at my photo... I bought 9.5x9.5x3/4. I got 9.75x9.75x.75. ridiculous. Waste of money. I had to install them because I had a brand new $10000 system installed and couldn't go with it opened and no filter.So there goes $35. Not to mention the other grilles which aren't correct. Avoid at all costs.

author: DDG
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2017
review_content: We've gone all-in on FilterBuy filters.  We notice no difference between these and big-box store filters, or big name brands.  Our HVAC annual maintenance guy has no issue with them, either (routine maintenance only....never had an HVAC problem).This off-label brand has the cardboard criss-cross pattern on both sides...not just one.  Another off-label brand (via Amazon) only had it on one side and the filters would bow towards the end of their 3 month (max) life.MERV 8 is just fine for basic residential usage.
title: We've gone all-in on FilterBuy filters.

author: GY
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2019
review_content: I’ve been buying name brand filters for our Carrier Weathermaker furnace from the big box and hardware stores. I usually purchase the mid-grade filters (that are comparable to this one on paper) or the next filter grade up from that. Their performance was fine, but the prices have been going up. Like many things before this, I shifted to Amazon to save some money. After looking at the good ratings, I concluded that the Silver grade FilterBuy filter would meet my needs and I bought a 4-pack in the 16x25x1 size.The good:  The filters arrived quickly and undamaged. They looked like the other good-quality filters I’m accustomed to. While all other filters I have purchased for this furnace have been slightly bigger than the slot and a struggle to install and take out, this filter has slightly smaller dimensions all around and slid right in without a fuss. I was off to a good start.The bad:  A few weeks after installing the first filter in the Fall, I noticed dust was accumulating on our flat surfaces faster than usual after dusting. I didn’t think much of it at first, but over the course of three months I suspected the new filter wasn’t doing its job. My suspicions were confirmed when I pulled the filter to replace it.  Having lived in my house for 25 years, I know what to expect in terms of dirt on the filter when I change it at the end of December. This filter was nowhere near as dirty, meaning it wasn’t stopping the dust effectively. When held up to the light, where my prior dirty filters would show only the faint sign of light, I not only saw a lot of light but also the fixture itself through small holes throughout the filter. Unfortunately, the experience with the second filter I changed at the end of March was no better. While I’m sure results will vary depending on furnace, ductwork, environment, etc., in my case the FilterBuy Silver filter did not perform as well as the other more expensive mid-grade name brand filters I have used.  If their higher-grade filter is less expensive than the other mid-grade options, I may give that a try.
title: It's not stopping the dust

author: Cary L. King
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019
review_content: These are made in Alabama and they must use Common Core Math because these are not 20x20x4 as stated...they're 19 3/8 x 19 3/8 x 3 5/8.  As most understand HVAC systems have 'rails' that hold the filter in place and these rails are made to a very specific size...like 20x20x4!  Not over a 1/2 inch short on each side.  When you don't have a tight fit it allows unfiltered air to pass through, call me crazy but I thought it's sole purpose was to do just that.  No where in the product information does it tell the consumer the size is different than 20x20x4...if it would have I wouldn't have purchased them.  Groan...
title: Not 20x20x4

author: Christopher
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2018
review_content: For the  last 15 years I have gone to the local Home Depot / Lowes and purchased a 12x24 inch filter for my home heating and air conditioning.  Without fail, they have all fit snugly.  The 12x24 filter does not fit well.  Its far to loose.  Its about a 1/4 inch less in width and height than the old filter.  This is some what reflected in the description, but one really shouldn't have to read the fine print on the dimensions to discover the 12x24 filter is really  23.3 x 11.5  inches.  One star for under sizing the  filter and not making it obvious.
title: but one really shouldn't have to read the fine print on the dimensions to discover the 12x24 filter ...

author: KM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2017
review_content: As many other buyers pointed out, these filters are not standard sizes. Compared to Honeywell and 3M filters they are almost 1/2 inch smaller letting  air in at the sides. Air resistance also seems very high. Makes a whistling sound not heard with any other filter. Very flimsy. The 20x20 filter looks like a bowl after a day. Make your self a solid and buy a quality product. Utter garbage!
title: If you want a low quality product - this is for you

author: Aerie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2019
review_content: After getting tired of using the washable filter that came with my one year old Carrier central air conditioning system, and with the okay from the installer, I started looking for filters to be replaced on a every-3-months, schedule. This is what we had been doing, using the Filtrete filters in our old system. Unfortunately, Filtrete does not make filters to fit my new Carrier air conditioning system. While looking, I came across this product and saw many glowing reviews and decided to take a chance on purchasing enough to last me for a year. Replacement was to be done every 90 days. Today, I opened the slot to remove the old filter and was shocked at what I saw. It appears to be extensive mold and something I have never seen before using any other product, including the original washable filter. I have attached a photograph and I will be looking for a new product. At the very least, I would suggest people checking the filter monthly to make sure that no mold is growing to scary heights.Update:Because I had purchased a number of these filters, I followed my own instructions and checked monthly to make sure there was no mold growing on the filters. There never was an issue past the first time that I used them. Not sure why there was such an issue the first time. I have a virtually new air conditioner and I could not imagine mold being a problem and it had never happened before with even my old air conditioner. Everything seems to be working fine and I will be purchasing additional filters by this company.
title: Didn't Work For Us/ Update-Seems to Be Better Now

author: Tom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2018
review_content: I received the filters in 2 days so I would have to rate that as outstanding. As for the filters, they appear to be sturdy, high quality filters,  worth the extra cost compared to the flimsy Walmart brand. I am not sure how long they will last because it doesn't state this anywhere. I am guessing I will have to change them out monthly though. I know some of the other comments suggested the filters are supposed to last 3 months each which makes this pack of 4 a year supply, but I highly doubt it. The filters do not have any built in notches or handles on the end either, so I'll probably have to pry them out with a screwdriver or pliers.  Other than that, I will probably reorder them.
title: Good quality and sturdy filters

author: Phil R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2018
review_content: The common measurement (24x24x1) I ordered was printed correctly on the filters I purchased. As I was attempting to install one of the filters, I was puzzled when the filter appeared to be too small and kept getting sucked through the frame. The unit needs to be on so that it’ll stay in place while balancing myself on a ladder with both my arms over my head. Having never had this problem with other brands of filters, I decided to measure these new filters. All four that I purchased were smaller than what they claimed to be. (Actual measurement is 23.25 x 23.75 x 0.75)Pretty aggravated with this product.
title: Pretty aggravated with this product.

author: IMHO
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2018
review_content: We recently purchased a new furnace that takes 4" deep pleated filters. The original filter only lasted 3 months, not the 6  was told. When it came time to change the filter, the furnace salesman said that these filters are custom made and cost $50 each. He insisted that I could not purchase appropriate filters from anyone except his company. Total lie! These FilterBuy filters (and several other brands) fit just fine for 1/4 the price. And the filters arrived a few days sooner than expected. The only reason I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 is that I will have a wait a few months to see if they last as long (or longer) that the original filter. If they do, I will increase my rating to 5 stars. NOTE: It is important to look at the "actual" measurements of all filters rather than their "nominal" measurements. The actual measurements for these filters are correct for me.
title: Furnace salesmen lie. Try this brand.

author: James Allen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2019
review_content: So... I receive my pack of 4 of these things. They are ultra cheap, bend way too easily and do NOT have the metal wiring shown in the picture. One of the filters was so poorly constructed it shut down my HVAC due to backdraft (note I'm in a fairly new house with no HVAC issues). Swapping in another one solved the problem; but you can "hear" the difference in each filter (the sound of the air at the intake). Sadly, this is just cheap Chinese junk. I don't know how these filters have such "good" reviews. Either people don't know a quality filter, or the reviews are fake (which is a big problem on amazon right now). Either way, I won't be buying these again - ever.
title: Terrible quality - pictures are inaccurate - false reviews?

author: Michelle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019
review_content: I bought a 4-pack of the 20x30x1 filters based on MERV rating and the Amazon reviews.There was a little shipping damage, and my filters were slightly crushed along one edge.  I don't dock the product for shipping damage, and I don't think the damage was severe enough to affect performance of the product, which has a cardboard frame.However, the frame isn't the right size.  The filter is about half a centimeter short in both dimensions.  I've attached pictures to illustrate.  For comparison is a (dirty) 20x30x1 furnace filter of similar MERV rating bought at an orange store.  Two pictures show the gaps in both dimensions between the old filter and the new FilterBuy product.  Whereas the orange box filter was a perfect fit, the FilterBuy filter has significant wiggle room.  Although there is not a visible gap after installation, I'm not sure I'm getting the same performance anymore.The other picture I've included shows both filters side by side in their entirety.  You can count the number of pleats in the medium of each filter for yourself.  There are quite a few more pleats in the old filter.  I believe more filtering medium produces cleaner filtered air, given the same MERV rating.  Furthermore, you can see there is more cardboard material securing the medium in place.  What you can't see is that the old filter is also better secured in place by that criss-cross cardboard pattern:  I plucked at a cardboard strip on the FilterBuy product, and it separated from the filtering medium easily.  This did not happen with the old filter, and I pulled at its cardboard strips much harder.I'll use these filters, but I won't buy them again.  I can see the corners they've cut (literally) to reduce costs.  I'll continue searching for another product with better value, perhaps with closer build quality to the Honeywell filter I bought at my local orange store but with a pricetag closer to the FilterBuy.
title: Likely Will Not Purchase Again

author: Chad Peterson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2019
review_content: They seem to be decent quality filters- hence the 2 stars- but for some reason they are smaller than advertised. the 14x14x1 is actually 13.5x13.5x.75 and the 14x20x1 is actually 13.5x19.5x.75. If they were mounted anywhere besides in the ceiling- it may be ok. Being as mine are in the ceiling, they won't stay in place when you try and install them- so it's a game of trying to line up the filter AND get the cover closed to hold them in place. Being smaller also causes the filters to slam upwards when the HVAC turns on, and fall back down when it turns off. My girlfriend freaked out, locked herself in the bathroom and was ready to call the cops because she thought someone was in the house since it sounds like a door opening and closing!! The next issue I have- when the filter drops- particulates that it has trapped will be shaken out through the vent, when the unit kicks on, it ha a moment where the filter is not sealed like it should be and unfiltered air will bypass the filter. I COULD duct tape the filters in place- or wedge cardboard or some other material in place- but this shouldn't be an issue. The manufacturer should sell the CORRECT size filters. This isn't lumber- these are standard filter sizes used by every HVAC unit I've had.  Why this was "Amazon recommended" is beyond me. I'll spend the extra couple of dollars next time to get the correct dimensional sizes
title: undersized-  sounds like a door closing when hvac blower switches on and off

author: Todd W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2020
review_content: I've purchased two packs of these filters for the units in my home.  Because my home is two story and located in Phoenix, AZ, there are actually three different AC units and replacing 6 filters every 3 months was costing me a fortune.  I got these just to check and see if I could save any money with them.  The result - these are fantastic filters for less money than what you can get at the local big box store.  They easily fit and are as sturdy as the ones I was purchasing previously.  I've noticed less dust on the furniture and shelves after putting these in as well so I know they are doing a great job - not to mention that I can see the amount of stuff they've captured when I change them.  When compared side by side with the other brand both did a great job of capturing visible dust.  I haven't done any additional testing, but these look to be as good as what I've been using.
title: Great filter at a lower price

author: Shafqatullah Syed
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2020
review_content: I hate to do this but I too was coerced by the magnitude of positive reviews. I should have went with my gut and stayed with the normal Honeywell/3M filters. Yes they are more but that  is the price to pay for piece of mind. FOr the past 4 days I have been dealing with a problem with my AC. I do not want to bore you with the details but I have done all I could do as  homeowner besides replace the entire unit. Before anyone recommends anything I can tell you that I have tried it. I am technical and mechanically inclined. I have narrowed it down to the air flow from the filters. I do not have the issue as many do about the size. I have 25X25X1 inch filters. To address the build quality-- I am sorry but these were questionable to me as soon as I held them in my hands. I did not feel confident at all.  I have deduced that these are restricting enough air flow to by coils that it is leaking water on the filter. And that is bad for these specifically as they immediately warp with just a minute amount of water. Water is dropping from my coils on top of the filter and as a result it is inhibiting aire flow and results in more water at a faster rate. I just bought a few Honeywell ones and I am going to replace them and see if this improved it at all. I will try to remember to get an update to my initial review.
title: Looks good but...(PLEASE REad)

author: Steven Rosenberg
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020
review_content: I bought these filters knowing they were smaller than pretty much all other 14x24x1 filters. The "full-size" filters are a very tight fit in my system -- I really have to bend and shove to get them in. These are small enough that I don't have to do that. They could be a smidge bigger and be even better, but this size is good enough, and it makes changing the filter much, much easier. Get a pack and see how they fit in your system. I will definitely keep buying these.
title: These ARE smaller than most other 14x24x1 filters

author: SpiderDan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2019
review_content: To start - I am a regular 'ole home user.I bought these as they were advertised as "Made in USA" - and I believe in putting my money where my mouth is by supporting my fellow Americans. They arrived in 2 days (Amazone Prime) and in good condition. They measured 23-3/8" x 23-3/8" x 7/8". The filters themselves say 3/4" thick, but all 4 of mine were just that 1/8" bigger. Didn't matter to me, as they seemed to fit better in my HVAC unit.I've been using the Filtrete MERV equivalent, but as I couldn't find where THOSE were actually made (I therefore assumed NOT in America somewhere.....), I wanted to buy a definite American product. I prefer to buy the higher MERV rating, as I definitely notice the difference in air quality and greatly reduced dust in the house with the higher rating items. I replace them 4x / year on a schedule. I have 2 cats, but no smokers and just my wife and I; but the occasional guest/visitor.So far, the one I've put in seems to be working as I'd expect. If anything changes or I have any particular feedback over time, I'll follow up. Otherwise, they are a good value!
title: Exactly as advertised and expected.

author: Aaron Schlaegel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2019
review_content: I originally was influenced to get these because they were made in USA.The first filters arrived squished, so I sent them back and got free replacements. It is frustrating to have to do this, but that is good service.The second batch had black stains on the filters, which were inside of plastic wrap. That wasn't the real issue though. The real issue was that the filters were smaller than their listed size. I've purchased filters for this air system for many years and I have never seen one with so much space on either side of the filter. I ended up using hot melt glue to attach cardboard spacers onto the sides of the filters. I wouldn't purchase this brand of filters again.*The pictures show this filter (the smaller one) next to a standard size filter to get a sense of the difference in size. Note that they both list the same dimensions.
title: Smaller than standard filter at that size

author: clintb
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2018
review_content: Update: 9/18/18: was very happy with the first order of these filters in 2017, however the quality seems to have slipped over the last year. When I received my new shipment of filters recently I noticed a few changes. First, they were all stuck together causing the cardboard to peel as I tried separating them. Previously they were wrapped in packs of 2 allowing me to store the extras without worry of dust. There also now were only 8 pleats over the entire surface of the filter. The old ones from last year had 12 pleats per filter. Meaning 1/3 less surface area to filter the air. It seems quality is really lacking with this shipment and No longer the bargain it used to be. Will be looking for something else when it’s time to reorder. 2017 review: Great filters and cheaper than buying at the local big box store. Will continue to use these.
title: Quality Slipping

author: Kurt Stefan

author: Christopher Michael Gray

review_content: I am a licensed Professional Engineer in 3 states and a licensed HVAC Contractor as well, and I absolutely approve these filters.
